original: Value Added Tax
result: Value Added Tax, commonly abbreviated as VAT, is a tax system that is levied on the sale of goods and services. It is collected at each stage of the supply chain and is based on the incremental value that each stage adds to the product or service. VAT is a form of indirect tax, which means that the tax burden is ultimately borne by the end consumer. It is used by many countries around the world as a means of generating revenue for the government.

original: Goods and Service Tax
result: The following is a possible rephrased version: The Goods and Services Tax, often abbreviated as GST, is a tax system that applies to the supply of goods and services in many countries. It is a consumption-based tax that is intended to replace other indirect taxes, such as sales tax and value-added tax. GST is usually levied at a percentage rate of the transaction value and collected at each stage of the supply chain, from the manufacturer or importer to the final consumer. The implementation of GST typically requires changes in the accounting and operational practices of businesses, as well as the tax administration and compliance systems of the government. In some countries, GST has been controversial due to its impact on consumers, businesses, and the economy overall.

original: The tax collected at the source

original: Tax deducted at source etc.
result: Tax deducted at source (TDS) is a form of tax collection where the tax amount is deducted by the payer before the payment is made to the payee. This amount is then deposited with the government on behalf of the payee. TDS is applicable to various types of income such as salaries, interest, commission, rent, etc. It ensures that the government receives regular tax payments and also helps in combating tax evasion.
